Package com.intellij.psi

Class AbstractFileViewProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.util.UserDataHolderBase
      • com.intellij.psi.AbstractFileViewProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UserDataHolder, UserDataHolderEx, FileViewProvider, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DummyHolderViewProvider, MultiplePsiFilesPerDocumentFileViewProvider, SingleRootFileViewProvider

    public abstract class AbstractFileViewProvider
extends UserDataHolderBase
implements FileViewProvider

      • getManager

        public final PsiManagerEx getManager()
        Specified by:
        getManager in interface FileViewProvider
        Returns:
        this project's PsiManager

      • getContents

        public java.lang.CharSequence getContents()
        Specified by:
        getContents in interface FileViewProvider
        Returns:
        the contents of this file view provider, which are parsed into PSI trees. May or may not be equal to the contents of the corresponding document. The latter happens for non-committed documents. If the document is modified but not yet committed, the result is equivalent to PsiDocumentManager.getLastCommittedText(Document).
        See Also:
        FileViewProvider.getDocument(), PsiDocumentManager.isUncommited(Document)

      • getVirtualFile

        public VirtualFile getVirtualFile()
        Specified by:
        getVirtualFile in interface FileViewProvider
        Returns:
        the virtual file corresponding to this view provider. Physical or an instance of LightVirtualFile for most non-physical files.

      • getDocument

        public Document getDocument()
        Specified by:
        getDocument in interface FileViewProvider
        Returns:
        the document corresponding to this file. Can be null for binary or files without events enabled.
        See Also:
        FileType.isBinary(), PsiBinaryFile, FileViewProvider.isEventSystemEnabled()

      • getPsi

        public final PsiFile getPsi(Language target)
        Specified by:
        getPsi in interface FileViewProvider
        Returns:
        PsiFile for given language, or null if the language is not present

      • clone

        public FileViewProvider clone()
        Specified by:
        clone in interface FileViewProvider
        Overrides:
        clone in class UserDataHolderBase
        Returns:
        a copy of this view provider, built on a LightVirtualFile, not physical and with PSI events disabled.
        See Also:
        FileViewProvider.isPhysical(), FileViewProvider.isEventSystemEnabled(), FileViewProvider.createCopy(VirtualFile)

      • findElementAt

        public PsiElement findElementAt(int offset,
                                Language language)
        Specified by:
        findElementAt in interface FileViewProvider
        Returns:
        the deepest (leaf) PSI element in the PSI tree with the specified root language at the specified offset.
        See Also:
        FileViewProvider.getBaseLanguage(), FileViewProvider.findElementAt(int)

      • beforeContentsSynchronized

        public void beforeContentsSynchronized()
        Description copied from interface: FileViewProvider
        Invoked before document or VFS changes are processed that affect PSI inside the corresponding file.
        Specified by:
        beforeContentsSynchronized in interface FileViewProvider

      • contentsSynchronized

        public void contentsSynchronized()
        Description copied from interface: FileViewProvider
        Invoked after PSI in the corresponding file is synchronized with the corresponding document, which can happen after VFS, document or PSI changes.

        Multi-language file view providers may override this method to recalculate template data languages.

        Specified by:
        contentsSynchronized in interface FileViewProvider
        See Also:
        FileViewProvider.getLanguages()

      • onContentReload

        public final void onContentReload()

      • rootChanged

        public void rootChanged(PsiFile psiFile)
        Description copied from interface: FileViewProvider
        Invoked when any PSI change happens in any of the PSI files corresponding to this view provider.
        Specified by:
        rootChanged in interface FileViewProvider
        Parameters:
        psiFile - the file where PSI has just been changed.

      • isEventSystemEnabled

        public boolean isEventSystemEnabled()
        Specified by:
        isEventSystemEnabled in interface FileViewProvider
        Returns:
        whether PSI events are fired when changes occur inside PSI in this view provider. true for physical files and for some non-physical as well.
        See Also:
        PsiTreeChangeListener, PsiFileFactory.createFileFromText(String, FileType, CharSequence, long, boolean), PsiElement.isPhysical()

      • isPhysical

        public boolean isPhysical()
        Specified by:
        isPhysical in interface FileViewProvider
        Returns:
        whether this file corresponds to a file on a disk. For such files, PsiFile.getVirtualFile() returns non-null. Not to be confused with PsiElement.isPhysical() which (for historical reasons) returns getViewProvider().isEventSystemEnabled()
        See Also:
        FileViewProvider.isEventSystemEnabled(), PsiElement.isPhysical()

      • getModificationStamp

        public long getModificationStamp()
        Specified by:
        getModificationStamp in interface FileViewProvider
        Returns:
        a number to quickly check if contents of this view provider have diverged from the corresponding VirtualFile or Document. If a document is modified but not yet committed, the result is the same as PsiDocumentManager.getLastCommittedStamp(Document)
        See Also:
        VirtualFile.getModificationStamp(), Document.getModificationStamp()

      • supportsIncrementalReparse

        public boolean supportsIncrementalReparse(Language rootLanguage)
        Specified by:
        supportsIncrementalReparse in interface FileViewProvider
        Returns:
        whether the PSI file with the specified root language supports incremental reparse.
        See Also:
        FileViewProvider.getLanguages()

        public PsiFile getStubBindingRoot()
        Specified by:
        getStubBindingRoot in interface FileViewProvider
        Returns:
        the PSI root for which stubs are to be built if supported. By default it's the main root.
        See Also:
        FileViewProvider.getBaseLanguage()

        public final FileType getFileType()
        Specified by:
        getFileType in interface FileViewProvider
        Returns:
        the same as getVirtualFile().getFileType(), but cached.
